summary: This is the Federal Bureau of Prisons' 24-hour death report for inmate Jeffery Edward Epstein, documenting his death by alleged suicide on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details the clinical timeline leading to his death, including his placement on and removal from suicide watch, and the emergency response when he was found unresponsive.

persons.name: Jeffery Edward Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate, a 66-year-old male with a history of sleep apnea and other medical conditions, who was found unresponsive in his cell and pronounced dead at a hospital.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: The emergency room physician at New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital who pronounced Jeffery Epstein dead at 7:36 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: At 2:00 a.m., Jeffery Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes due to an abrasion on the lower anterior surface of his neck.

events.title: Epstein taken off Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffery Epstein was taken off Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Jeffery Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where he was housed with a cellmate.

events.title: Psychology Services evaluation
events.description: Jeffery Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive and pronounced dead
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., Special Housing Unit staff found Jeffery Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated, EMS transported him to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital, where he was pronounced dead by the ER Physician at 7:36 a.m.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007)
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffery Edward Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at age 66, with the preliminary cause of death listed as 'Alleged Suicide'.

Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch on July 23, 2019, for just over 31 hours due to an abrasion on his neck, but was removed the next day and later placed in the general Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.
On August 8, 2019, two days before his death, Epstein was evaluated by Psychology Services and denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.
The emergency response began at 6:33 a.m. on August 10 when he was found unresponsive; he was pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m. after extensive resuscitation efforts.
The document is an official Bureau of Prisons 24-hour death report, dated August 12, 2019, confirming the autopsy was ordered and the death was not anticipated.
